alert.note: Alert for Lawrence; Martin (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 31 at 9:56PM EDT until April 04 at 8:00AM EDT by NWS Indianapolis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Indiana... East Fork White River near Rivervale...to Shoals. White River at Edwardsport...to Hazleton. .Widespread lowland flooding continues along the East Fork White River from Rivervale to Shoals....and along the White River at Edwardsport to Hazleton. Moderate flooding is occurring on the White River...at Petersburg...with brief moderate flooding possible at Hazleton Saturday. Moderate flooding is expected to end on the White River by Sunday. The East Fork White River has crested and is forecast to continue falling...while the crest on the White River will slowly advance from Petersburg to Hazleton tonight. Minor flooding is expected to end on most of the East Fork White River early next week...and on the White River...on Sunday at Edwardsport...while continuing at downriver points through next week. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...East Fork White River at Williams. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 11.0 feet, During the late March 2008 flood, the Bedford Times reported the following County roads still flooded; River Road, entire road; Bartlettsville Road, by the bridge and in the bottoms; Judah-Logan Road, by the bridge; Logan Bottoms, the gravel part; Donica Church Road, between Logan Bottom and the hill; Peerless Road, by Mica Metals; Little Salt Creek Run; Stumphole Bridge Road, near Indiana 450; Huron-Williams Road; Lawrenceport Road; Rivervale Road and Earl Road. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:33 AM EDT Friday the stage was 10.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 7:33 AM EDT Friday was 10.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.7 feet just after midnight tonight. It will then fall below flood stage Monday evening. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/ind. This statement will be updated by noon Saturday.
